description: From stem of Medieval Latin expenditus, irregular perfect passive participle of expendō (“I weigh, I pay out”),  +‎ -ure (“process or result”).

entries.meaning: (uncountable, countable) Act of expending or paying out.
(uncountable, countable) The amount expended; expense; outlay.
examples: The expenditure of time, money, and political capital on this project has been excessive.
